conclusion: The graph shows velocity vs. time; positive direction on vertical axis is defined positive motion.
At t = 2s, velocity is 0 m·s⁻¹; between t = 2s and t = 3s, velocity decreases linearly to -2 m·s⁻¹; at t = 3s, velocity is -2 m·s⁻¹.
Negative velocity indicates motion opposite to the defined positive direction.
Negative displacement from t = 2s to t = 3s confirms motion in the negative direction.
From 2 to 3 seconds, the particle is moving opposite to the defined positive direction due to negative velocity.
